note.p: Birth: Market Bosworth, Leicestershire, England (25 December 1817)
Education: Rugby School; Market Bosworth Grammar School; University College, London. MD
Career: Appointed Superintendent, Devon county Lunatic Asylum (1844); Chancery Visitor of Lunatics (1862). Subsequently returned to private practice in London and founded the journal 'Brain'.
Freemason, initiated 8 March 1877 in the Lodge of Friendship No 6, London
Memberships: MRCS (1840); LRCP (1853); FRCP (1859); Physiological Society, Paris (Honorary)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 130-131 signed by T C A
Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 'Freemasons and the Royal Society: Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' 2010 page 12
